channel.title: Programming Language on Hashnopolis
channel.description: Recent content in Programming Language on Hashnopolis

item.title: Arrays in Python
item.description: Reverse an array arr = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8] reversedArray = arr[::-1] arr[3:5] = arr[3:5][::-1] Clone a list newArr = oldArr[:]

item.title: Arrays in CPP
item.description: To get the number of elements in an array in C++: sizeof(awesomeArray) = total number of bytes allocated for awesomeArray array. Divide it with the size of one element in the array will give you the number of elements in the array: sizeof(awesomeArray)/sizeof(awesomeArray[0])
